fields.description:
Today as a user is necessary to go through the steps as described in this documentation in order to migrate a repository from SVN to GIT: https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/migrating-overview

This takes a bit of time for the average user to implement, so since Bitbucket Cloud has no option to import SVN repositories, would it be possible to programmatically implement the conversion from SVN to GIT through the repository import functionality?
fields.summary: Automatically migrate SVN repositories to GIT on import

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Once trying to clone any snippet using HTTPS you should get a "remote: Repository not found", doesn't matter the permissions you've set. The same issue is not presented over SSH key.

h4. How to Replicate
# Create a snippet on any account (Team or Individual). _*(+) >> Create - Snippet >> Complete the fields with anything >> Create Snippet >> Clone >> copy the HTTPS url into your terminal.*_
# The account should authenticate properly, however, shortly thereafter gets a "remote: Repository not found".

h4. Workaround
[Set up an SSH key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/set-up-an-ssh-key-728138079.html] and use that for authentication.
fields.summary: Cloning snippets over HTTPS getting "remote: Repository not found"

fields.description:
Whenever you open a user and you're not logged in the system gives you a page saying:

bq. You were never here\\
This user has requested we keep their identity a mystery. Let's never speak of this again.


Instead of just a blank/useless page it would be nice to either be redirected to a login page or better, have a login dialog available.

Example link: https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/
fields.summary: Add a login dialog to the "You were never here" page

When you click on them, nothing happens.

fields.description:
Info Digital Account created an issue 42 seconds ago\\
Unable to push repository due to epository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit). A screen shot of this is attached in the link below.\\
https://monosnap.com/file/gpRkogrt0Ohmz0UzeRfjGX4oOH1AJW\\
Please help me resolve it.
fields.summary: Unable to push

fields.description:
When I am using my android Samsung s8+ with Chrome, profile view.

And I navigate to a pull request, I am initially shown the mobile navigation in the top left, but then the desktop sidebar is displayed. It sits over the top of anything in the main body area, and cannot be closed or removed.

I expect to see the mobile hamburger nav at the top, and not the desktop.
fields.summary: Desktop sidenav displayed in mobile.

fields.description:
My goal would be that in the list below, the first option would not be true:\\
!1717527362-Screen%20Shot%202018-09-13%20at%205.19.05%20PM.png|thumbnail!

That is, just because a teammate added me as a reviewer, it does not mean I wish to immediately start getting email notifications of all the activity. I prefer to review Pull Requests on my own schedule (e.g. beginning and end of day), so it's a lot of noise mid-day. Plus if a reviewer is out of the office for a few days, it creates unnecessary emails. Just one email about the open of the Pull Request would be ideal (or other major PR state changes).

The main reasoning is that I think only users themselves should be in control of when to start receiving lots of notifications. This is the one scenario (from the above list) where someone else appears to be in control.
fields.summary: Do not automatically add reviewers as watchers when someone else adds you as reviewer

fields.description:
I'm using our OAuth integration to pull a private repo from our account, and we keep getting 403 Forbidden errors as of yesterday. Nothing has changed on our end, the client key and secret that we're using matches what I see in the OAuth integration.

This is the affected account: https://bitbucket.org/tutum/

The error is breaking our CI/CD pipeline and blocking some further Bitbucket development we're doing.
fields.summary: Unauthorized error when using OAuth

fields.description:
Even after you disable Pipelines on the repository level, it still shows the last result on the overview page of the repository.\\
Expected: After disabling to Pipelines on the repository settings, the "latest build status" on the overview page should disappear.

Workaround: Remove Bitbucket Pipelines on the account level, by doing the following:

# Bitbucket Settings
# Manage Integrations
# Expand Pipelines
# Select "Remove" and confirm
fields.summary: After being disabled, Pipelines build last result still appears on the overview page

fields.description:
Allow Pipelines build to return Fail status when artifact fails to upload due to the 1GB size limit.

This will be helpful for users who rely on artifacts on their next build step and to identify the cause of their failed build.
fields.summary: Fail the build when the build's artifact size reach the 1GB limit

fields.description: If I re-run a failed step in pipelines, the logs from the failure seem to be overwritten by the new logs. I'd like to see the history there (so that I know the pipeline failed for some reason).
fields.summary: View logs from all step reruns

fields.description:
"Now that is a lot of code! There's simply too much in this diff for us to render it all."

This message left me with bad feels (happened on a package-lock.json).

Some suggestions:

# Don't act surprised/incredulous - it's judgemental and makes people feel bad.
# Don't treat the size as an excuse "There's simply too much" is a judgemental "you fucked up" whereas something like "We've limited diffs to X lines" would be a non-judgemental "we can't support you"
# Offer a solution "To view these changes, please clone the repository and run {{git ...}}".
fields.summary: Improvements to "Diff too large" message

fields.description:
AS A consultant WHO IS an administrator of several different client's bitbuckets teams (i.e. project owners)\\
I WANT to _quickly_ navigate to the landing page for a specific owner\\
SO THAT I can administer that team such as creating new projects or adding team members.

Currently to do this I have to search for a repo, then go to that repo, then click the breadcrumb menu to get to the owner's landing page.

The home page has the following in it's navigation menu.

* Your work
* Repositories
* Projects
* Pull requests
* Issues
* Snippets

I propose adding an additional landing page called 'teams' or similar which lists all the owners of repos that I have access to administer.
fields.summary: Be able to see Teams I'm part from the Home Page navigation menu

fields.description:

With Atlassian Access and Identity Manager, perhaps there could be a possibility to manage a user's SSH keys (along with the account)
fields.summary: Support organization-managed SSH keys (Atlassian Access / Identity Manager) for Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
A few days ago there was a bug with deleting repositories, see this issue for more details: BCLOUD-17130.

That problem seems to be fixed but it has caused another issue. The repositories that were "deleted" are now badly corrupted and it is impossible to get rid of them. For example:

* They do appear in the dashboard/repositories overview, but they do *not* appear in the profile/repositories overview.
* Clicking on the repository results in the 404 page with the message "That link has no power here".
* They do appear in the result of the api request https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$user but they can *not* be deleted by the api request https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$user/$slug
fields.summary: Corrupted repositories

This lead to searching for a file I knew was changed in the list for far longer than I want to admit.
fields.summary: Files in branch diff vanish from list after clicking

So now commits with those in their description pickup a "random" user name

(Do @'d users also get notified randomly when this happens? <-- slight security issue potentially?)

fields.description:
Hi,

We are StiltSoft, Platinum Top Vendor at Atlassian Marketplace.

We have a free app Awesome Graphs for Bitbucket Cloud. This app visualize repository statistics. We would like to implement a lot of new features into the app. It will give Bitbucket Cloud more competitive advantages in comparison with GitHub.

To implement new features we will need to have an ability to make many API requests, more than allowed by current rate limits.

We asked Atlassian to raise rate limits for our app, but received an answer, that currently it is impossible to have custom rate limits for apps or users.

So we ask your development team to implement custom API rate limits for apps.

This feature will help us and other developers of apps for Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Custom API rate limits for apps

I would love to see an extension like this for Bitbucket to work with PR inside of an editor like VSCode or PyCharm/IntelliJ. I know this is a large ask but it is one of the biggest tooling areas in my workflow that I think could be better.

fields.description:
I just tried to download my repositories code from the tag tab, because I wanted the code for a specific tagged version. I selected the gzipped version, and was a bit surprised when I saw the downloaded files name.

The naming convention for these files seem to be {{[team]-[repository]-[commit-hash].[file-extension]}}.\\
I can live with this, but I honestly expected the tag to be included. Especially because the URL for the download has the form {{https://bitbucket.org/dataproces/text-search-service/get/[tag].tar.gz}}, and the tag is the information that is important to me in this case. After all, I did initiate the download from the tag tab.

This led me to think about how I would optimally have the files named, such that they are readable, and include the information that is important.

First of all, I suggest that the character between the parts is changed to an underscore ({{_}}), instead of a hyphen ({{-}}) because the hyphen is used between words in repository name slugs. This gives us the following form: {{[team]_[repository]_[commit-hash].[file-extension]}}

Secondly, I would like the tag to be included. I suggest the following form for this: {{[team]_[repository]_tag-[tag]_[commit-hash].[file-extension]}}.\\
The observant reader will notice the {{tag_}} that prepends the tag. This, I hope, is obvious from reading the next paragraph.

Thirdly, downloads from the branch tab should probably have something similar to tags done to it, and in accordance with the above, this gives us the following form:  {{[team]_[repository]_branch-[branch]_[commit-hash].[file-extension]}}

Lastly, one could argue that including the current date(+time?) in a branch file name would be beneficial as well.

That was it from me (for now). Please add your thoughts below, if you have a contribution to this discussion I am hoping to start with this proposal.
fields.summary: Improve download file naming
FE not responding after click merge or update or create

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pipelines return "System Error - Error occured whilst uploading artifact" status if directories outside of configured artifact directories have too many levels of symbolic links.

This issue only happens if yml configuration using "**" patterns

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  branches:
    temp*:
      - step:
...........
            - ls -alh
          artifacts:
            - my_directory/**
      - step:
          name: Deploy to development
...........
{code}

h3. Workaround
Remove the package/directory which has too many directory level/symlink at the end of the build.

Example:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  branches:
    temp*:
      - step:
...........
            - ls -alh
            - yarn remove next
          artifacts:
            - my_directory/**
      - step:
          name: Deploy to development
...........
{code}
fields.summary: Fail to upload artifact if other directories has too many levels of symbolic links
Human readable format for cron in the UI (scheduled builds)

fields.description:
I like most of the service if it works out as credits. You buy X minutes and stick with it until you finish and not a monthly plan.

I'm uploading all my sites using Bitbucket Pipelines. My time is up and I would like to buy more, but I have no interest in a monthly fixed plan, since I do not use constant updates.

Good, but that's just a suggestion, as I'm not the primary customer type of your products.

Thank you, Elias Costa.

fields.description: Similar to Bitbucket Cloud's ability to validate whether if the commit messages contain JIRA issue keys via the Links settings in the repository's settings, Bitbucket Cloud should also have the ability to validate other JIRA fields such as *Component* and *Summary* before the pushed commit is accepted.

fields.description:

It would be great if we can collapse the comments or be able to change the order to show the latest comment on the top to make it easier to review the latest comment.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Receiving a Javascript script error after login when accessing a website first.

Steps to reproduce:

# Access this link: https://cloud.yandex.ru/docs/vpc/pricing
# Change the address to Bitbucket.org (in the same tab)
# Login

h3. *Expected Result*
Bitbucket dashboard will load

h3. *Actual Result*
Bitbucket dashboard is not loading

h3. *Workaround*
# Avoid accessing the website and login will work.
# Open a new tab then access Bitbucket.org when this occurs

fields.description:
When setting the iframe of a fileviewer module to take up the parent's space by [setting the 'sizeToParent' data-option to {{true}} when importing the Javascript library|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/about-the-javascript-api/#options], the resulting iframe takes up more space than is available in the host window.

I did not test if this also applies to other modules.

See attached screenshot. Notice the scrollbar indicating the file viewer iframe goes beyond the bottom of the page.

!863993206-Screen%20Shot%202018-09-21%20at%2017.35.04.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: File viewer iframe too high when set to parent height using sizeToParent

fields.description:
Normally, markdown content hosted in Bitbucket can be extracted by using the "Open raw" action on the ellipsis menu.

(e.g. The file https://bitbucket.org/adastradev/test-open-source-pipeline/src/master/Readme.md can be viewed at https://bitbucket.org/adastradev/test-open-source-pipeline/raw/d663c4c3eb8c464bd10c03cc66f4d0b5b80c32c4/Readme.md).

This is very helpful for integrations with Confluence, where the Markdown Extensions for Confluence plugin can mirror markdown content that needs to be version controlled out in Confluence for a wider audience.

For Bitbucket wiki pages (e.g. https://bitbucket.org/adastradev/png-engineering-practices/wiki/dev-tool-chain-git.md), there doesn't appear to be any way to see the raw markdown markup, so it is not possible to mirror any of the Bitbucket wiki content in Confluence).
fields.summary: Provide the ability to "Open raw" on markdown files inside a bitbucket wiki

fields.description:
We would like the ability to initialize a new release branch in a product where we support multiple active releases, but we still want to retain the ability to make changes to release branches go through pull requests. Is this possible given the current branch permissions model?

As it is, we've had to add some explicit permissions to allow certain individuals to create these branches.

!786091282-BranchPermissions.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch permissions - unable to allow initializing a branch without granting full write access

fields.description: Sometimes a project can have many repos. Adding a new user group on a per repo basis can be time consuming when it could also be handled at a more global project level also.
fields.summary: user and group access per project

fields.description:
We're using the Bitbucket REST API for automation, and in some cases use endpoints from the v1 API, since (somewhat surprisingly) v2 of the API doesn't comprise everything that's contained in v1.\\
Now I've discovered that v1 is deprecated and will be disabled at the end of the year (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/), and according to that document there is no equivalent to the group-privileges endpoint in v2, so it looks like that part of our automation would then simply stop working.\\
Thus, please include group privilege management functionality in v2 of the Bitbucket REST API.
fields.summary: Bitbucket REST API v2 is incomplete

fields.description:

Unfortunately, for all my deployments there is always shown{{Issues(0)}} even though the JIRA issues are mentioned in the commit message and when I click on Jira issue hyperlink in the commit message, the issue is open correctly.

There is a small error box in the left bottom corner but without any error details.

Currently web UI just display the public key as a whole, but it doesn't seem to allow copy-and-paste, which makes identifying (comparing) the key in the another host difficult.\\
It would be really helpful if web UI shows key's fingerprint (as github does).

fields.description:
When searching in Bitbucket, if I type in the name of a repository the search will come up empty. However, if I use the standardized repository name it will display the results.

Ex. Say I have a repository with the repository named "Project Foo". If I search for "Project Foo" I'll get no results found. But if I search for "project-foo" it will display the repository as "Project Foo" in the results list.

Suggestion, allow both "Project Foo" and "project-foo" to return the repository result.
fields.summary: Include name in repository search matches

fields.description:
Life is chaos - you write a readme for a project but after some time some of the websites you linked go down, projects get renamed, tutorials deleted and so on.

What if BitBucket scanned periodically your readme and raised issues for every unique link in there if that link produces a 404?

GitHub does not have this yet by the way and there are loads of *broken links* in Open Source projects' readme's everywhere: on BitBucket, on GitHub, on GitLab — everywhere.
fields.summary: Automatically raise issues for all unique 404 links detected in readme file

fields.description:

fields.description:
When adding a [fileviewer module|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/modules/file-viewer/] the height of the iframe for the fileviewer is sized to fit the content, not to fill the remaining space on the page. This works well for e.g text based viewers, but for graphical viewers, especially those utilizing zooming, sizing to take up all available space makes a lot more sense.

It would be very useful to have the module tell Bitbucket whether the iFrame should fit the content or fill the remaining space.

E.g I am working on a file viewer for PCB CAD files. These CAD files are typically big (mostly landscape A4 format) and thus the fileviewer allows to pan and zoom these files and the viewbox takes all available space. However, since Bitbucket sets the height of the iframe for the viewer to fit it's contents, the iframe is only as big as the fixed-height menu items, making the fileviewer pretty much useless:

!671080524-Screen%20Shot%202018-09-03%20at%2000.46.15.png|thumbnail!

The only way to currently fix this is to set a fixed height to the viewbox, either resulting in unused space or extra scrollbars negatively impacting usability, or coming up with a complicated workaround to detect the maximum height impacting performance.
fields.summary: Add option to make fileviewer height fill remaining height

fields.description: It does work with GitHub, Visual Studio Online and others. Please fix it.
fields.summary: Git Blame plugin for VS Code cannot open a commit in bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi,

Env: Bitbucket Cloud\\
Plan: Standard Plan

I found the default reviewer for PR in a repo has some issues:

# When an employee left the company, we remove him/her from the bitbucket plan. But the user still stays as a reviewer in the team repositories. And you have to remove him/her as default reviewer from each repository.
# You have to add individual default reviewer instead of adding the whole user group.

Expect result:

Once the user has been removed from the plan, he/she should be removed from any repositories as default reviewer.
fields.summary: Remove default reviewers when their repository access has been revoked

fields.description: When BitBucket notifies about comments on Issues in Slack, some more information would be helpful. In particular, I'd like to have the Milestone attribute included. However, a settings panel that allowed users to customize their chat notifications might be even better!
fields.summary: Include Milestone in Issue Notifications (Bonus: configure which attributes are included)

fields.description:
From BCLOUD-15146

bq. the original problem which led to the creation of this issue:\\
repository settings: premium features with requiring pull request approvals before merge, and reset approvals on change

* User A creates a pull request on a branch : PR1
* User B approves PR1
* User A makes a new commit to the branch: because of "reset approvals on change"  PR1 is not in "approved" state any more
* User B approves PR1 (again)
* User A is not notified about the second approval
fields.summary: Notification not sent for approval (after approvals have been reset?)

fields.description:
I am a college professor and my students use Bitbucket for their version control.  They add me so that I am able to view their repos, but as part of their grade, they must make their repos private.  Since I have been added to the repo for grading purposes, there is no way for me to see if it is public or private.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Place a lock symbol on private repos

fields.summary: test

fields.description:
Having tasks (or checkboxes) in comments makes PR reviews a little easier and helps other reviewers see the status of a PR by the number of tasks left unticked. It would be useful to create a PR with a task list by default (e.g. A PR that is waiting on another one to go before it can be implemented might have a checkbox saying so in the description) by allowing checkboxes to be added to the description when the PR is created.

It would be massively useful for my workflow where I inject a pull request template into the description (using refined bitbucket). The pull request template by default has tasks (as markdown checkboxes) that need to be ticked off.

If those checkboxes were tracked like tasks it would be massively useful.
fields.summary: Add support for tasks/checkboxes in pull request descriptions

fields.description:
It would be great if we could add the ability to obtain through API the Plan Details which includes the usage of Build Minutes, LFS Storage, and Number of users accounted on the plan.\\
This is so users could track the usage over time especially (build minutes + storage).
fields.summary: Ability to pull Plan Details & Usage (Build Minutes / LFS Storage) through API

But if the step in in {{custom}} pipeline, it does not show that.

fields.description: like ellipsis {{…}} in the JSON payload crashes it with 400 bad request.
fields.summary: API 2.0 does not accept some symbols in JSON

fields.description:
The failure are intermittent, but it cause stability issue on our CI run, every once a while the build will fail with 500 returned from bitbucket.

I can repro the problem locally on my dev box's command prompt.

Ex: i run the exactly command 3 times and one of them are failed.

{code}
xxxxxxx@xxxx MINGW64 /c/vsts-agent/_layout/_work/1/s (master)
$ git -c http.extraheader="AUTHORIZATION: basic xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" fetch --tags --prune --progress --no-recurse-submodules origin

xxxxxxx@xxxx MINGW64 /c/vsts-agent/_layout/_work/1/s (master)
$ git -c http.extraheader="AUTHORIZATION: basic xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" fetch --tags --prune --progress --no-recurse-submodules origin
fatal: unable to access 'https://bitbucket.org/xxxxxx/test-main-repository/': The requested URL returned error: 500

xxxxxxx@xxxx MINGW64 /c/vsts-agent/_layout/_work/1/s (master)
$ git -c http.extraheader="AUTHORIZATION: basic xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" fetch --tags --prune --progress --no-recurse-submodules origin

{code}

Looks like something wrong on the bitbucket server side that causing the 500 error.
fields.summary: Intermittent 500 from bitbucket on git fetch

fields.description:
API support of deployment keys in V2 is critical for our CI and without that support is will cause us to move away from BitBucket.

This feature has been in place in v1 and now removing it as of 12/31/2018 is a very big deal for those of use who use these extensively.

Please, add the feature back or provide guide on what the proposed work-a-round would be.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add support for deploy keys in API v2

fields.description:
Hi,

Usually, during the afternoon (Israeli time), BitButcket's performance becomes very poor causing our builds and tests to fail over and over again.

We are a SaaS based company which releases features and bug fixed continuously, and our customers suffer from these problems on a daily basis.

We are considering to replace BitBucket with GitLab due to its well known stability and performance.

We would like to discuss this issue with our account manager and understand these problems before we make our final decision regarding our migration to GitLab.

Cheers,\\
Tal
fields.summary: BitBucket performance is very poor

fields.description:
Hello.

I have a suspicion that GIT status does not measure {{Git average response time (HTTPS)}} and {{Mercurial average response time (HTTPS)}} correctly.\\
For the last ~10 hours the average response time is supposedly 0ms.

https://status.bitbucket.org/
fields.summary: Bitbucket status not measuring properly

fields.description:
See details here on Microsoft blog post:

https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vsoservice/?p=17345

This is a major show stopper for us and many people who rely on VSTS connecting to Bitbucket.

Please advise on ETA of resolution.
fields.summary: Bitbucket connection to VSTS
API - teams/{username}/members returns 500 when using created_on filter criteria

password:

fields.summary: HTTP Error 400: Bad Request For Pull Repo

fields.description:
It would be good to have stages that are not mandatory or block another stage from running.

The scenario we have is deploying to different countries that use the exact same code. If a change is made but we only want to deploy to one country, then we can't use Pipeline stages to do the deploy. We have to do a custom stage and deploy from a specific commit, which is extremely messy.

My proposal is that a "optional" param is passed into the stage and the next stage can run without considering the "optional" stage. OR, the entire branch stage has to be triggered manually and the inner stages can be triggered manually in any order.

That way, stages don't have to be "sequential".
fields.summary: Support optional steps

fields.description: When i committing and pushing from sourcetree, the author name displaying in bitbucket is in name of different one or several partners and not mine. All account setting is fine
fields.summary: Commit author name

fields.description:
In the mobile site, when viewing a commit, the sidebar is forced open and cannot be closed. This makes the commit view unusable for anything other than viewing the diffs, and guess all relevant metadata (commit message, author, etc).

In most pages, tapping anywhere outside of the sidebar closes it; but it does nothing on commit view.

In the attached screenshot, the sidebar is shown in its entirety. It covers all relevant information, and even covers the first few context lines of the diff. The issue persists in landscape orientation.
fields.summary: Mobile sidebar in commit view cannot be closed

fields.description:
I've been struggling with this for awhile. Suddenly my Organization account stop doing GCloud auth correctly. If I move my repository to my personal account without changing anything everything works for the pipelines and pushing a docker image to GCR.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/GCloud-unable-to-push-image-to-GCR-on-bitbucket-organization/qaq-p/875835#M110

Hopefully someone can help me figure this out...

Thanks
fields.summary: GCloud unable to push image to GCR on bitbucket organization account

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I'd really appreciate the functionality to categorise or group environment variables and show/hide them in the editing section based on the category.

Since our pipelines are growing bigger and getting more complex, the number of env variables is growing fast (App specific ones, Deployment variables,...).\\
A Grouping feature would really help to stay organized :)

Sorry in case this is a duplicate.

Best Wishes,\\
Stefan
fields.summary: Group environment variables in the UI
